meanings.definition: A penis wider than it is long.
meanings.sent1: He laughed at the joke about a chode in the comedy show.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the medical condition of having a chode to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled when they heard the word 'chode' in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The artist's sculpture resembled a chode, causing mixed reactions from viewers.
meanings.sent5: In the anatomy class, the diagram showed the structure of a chode clearly.

meanings.definition: A person who is annoying or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The chode in the office always disrupted meetings with his loud talking.
meanings.sent2: She found it hard to work with the chode who never cleaned up after himself.
meanings.sent3: The chode at the party kept telling bad jokes that no one found funny.
meanings.sent4: Dealing with that chode was like trying to catch a slippery fish.
meanings.sent5: The chode's behavior made everyone avoid him at the social gathering.

meanings.sent1: Please don't chode me while I'm trying to concentrate on my work.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site choded the residents of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: His little brother loved to chode him by hiding his favorite toys.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing mosquito continued to chode me as I tried to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The persistent salesperson choded me with calls even after I said I wasn't interested.
